title: Topsfield massage parlor shut down over alleged prostitution, trafficking
author: Samantha Genzer
bullets: Topsfield's FeiFei L Spa was shut down due to alleged prostitution and human trafficking.
The investigation involved Topsfield Police, Homeland Security, Middleton Police, and Massachusetts State Police.
Police issued a cease-and-desist order; criminal charges are pending as the investigation continues.

title: Charlie Coyle thankful for Bruins tenure in first game back with Boston
author: Conor Ryan
bullets: Charlie Coyle returned to Boston with the Columbus Blue Jackets, reflecting on his seven-season tenure with the Bruins.
The Blue Jackets, coached by Rick Bowness, are competing for an Eastern Conference playoff spot after a mid-season improvement.
Coyle, a Boston native and former fan favorite, expressed gratitude for his chance to play for the Bruins and in front of his family.

title: Amid trying year, Olympic gold shone even brighter for Charlie McAvoy and his family
author: Conor Ryan
bullets: Charlie McAvoy won Olympic gold with Team USA in Milan, celebrating with his family, including son Rhys and father Charles Sr.
McAvoy faced challenges in 2025, including shoulder and jaw injuries, but played a crucial role in Team USA's defensive success.
Following the Olympics, McAvoy returned to the Bruins, contributing an assist in a win against the Columbus Blue Jackets.

title: Did you follow the local news this week? Take our Greater Boston news quiz.
author: Peter Chianca
bullets: Boston.com offers a news quiz to test knowledge on recent Greater Boston news events.
The quiz is crafted by Peter Chianca, Boston.com’s general assignment editor since 2019.
Participants can gauge their awareness on trending stories in Greater Boston.

title: An injury scare had a Providence goalie in net for the Bruins on Thursday
author: Conor Ryan
bullets: Michael DiPietro stepped in as goalie for the Bruins after Joonas Korpisalo's injury scare during a game against Columbus.
Korpisalo was briefly pulled from the game due to a concussion protocol after being hit by Columbus's Miles Wood.
DiPietro, recalled from Providence Bruins, played for 6:03 and saved two shots before Korpisalo returned.

title: N.H. woman arrested for alleged murder of her baby following 11-month investigation
author: Darin Zullo
bullets: Hepay Juma, 26, charged with second-degree murder for infant's death in Manchester, N.H., announced by authorities.
Infant referred to as 'Baby Jane Grace Doe' found dead in Pine Island Pond on March 27, 2025.
Police received around 50 leads by April 2, doubling the reward to $5,000 for more information.

title: Way overdue on checking a car’s transmission fluid
author: John Paul
bullets: A 2006 Mazda3 owner changed black transmission fluid and was advised to flush it after 10,000 miles.
A 2019 Subaru Crosstrek owner got a $1,600 repair quote for tire sensors and control arm bushings.
A 2018 GMC Denali owner should regularly check and top off antifreeze due to possible evaporation without leaks.

title: South Shore school evacuated after snow causes ‘structural stress’ on roof
author: Carson Lyle
bullets: Plymouth River School in Hingham evacuated due to roof 'structural stress' from snow accumulation.
Students and staff relocated to Hingham High School for safety, with lunch and transportation provided.
Hingham received over 17 inches of snow, prompting building stress and assessment by roofing specialists.

title: David Ortiz changes his tune on Rafael Devers after previous criticism
author: Conor Ryan
bullets: David Ortiz criticized Rafael Devers after his 2025 trade from the Red Sox to the Giants over defensive performance.
Ortiz recently expressed love and respect for Devers on WEEI's 'Baseball Isn't Boring' podcast, noting he believes Devers learned from past events.
Ortiz described past comments as part of natural sports relationships, urging reconciliation and emphasizing admiration for Devers' talent.

title: Gas leak identified as cause of Taunton explosion that displaced 8 residents
author: Darin Zullo
bullets: A gas leak caused an explosion in Taunton, injuring a mother and daughter and destroying a three-family home.
Investigations are ongoing to pinpoint the leak's location and cause of ignition; no foul play is suspected.
Community fundraisers have raised over $33,000 for the displaced family and damaged neighboring homes.
